3. Phylogeny: Phylogenetic analysis based on 16S rRNA gene sequencing has placed Desulfobacula phenolica within the Deltaproteobacteria class, specifically within the Desulfobacteraceae family.

4. Ecology: As a sulfate-reducer, Desulfobacula phenolica plays a role in the sulfur cycle in freshwater sedimentary environments where it can degrade aromatic pollutants coupled to sulfate reduction.

Overall, Desulfobacula phenolica is an environmentally relevant bacterium capable of anaerobic degradation of phenolic compounds, making it of interest for bioremediation applications in contaminated aquatic ecosystems.
